Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add administrator portal for vulnerability metadata" (#7683) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This Admin page should allow the following:
- adding a vulnerability
- removing a vulnerability
- adding a package to a vulnerability
- removing a package from a vulnerability

Note that these behaviors should be done in such a way that GitHubVulnerabilities2Db does not overwrite them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Manage Package page forms should link back to the Manage page" (#7678) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7567
https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7495

Currently, when you submit a form on the Manage Package page (Deprecation, Listing, Documentation) you are linked back to the package details page. This is annoying when you are trying to do other management operations at the same time.

This changes it so that submitting the forms stays on the Manage Package page. Additionally, I added "TempData" messages so that it's clearer what operation was performed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fix spacing issue on organization page" (#7682) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Does overwriting snupkgs on Push make sense?" (#7681) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
**nupkg behavior:** If a nupkg exists, a consistent response of 409 will be returned. Client handles this differently based on whether -SkipDuplicate is provided as part of the push.

**snupkg behavior:** snupkg duplicates can sometimes behaves differently than nupkg duplicates (as is the case with nuget.org):

- If a snupkg already exists when pushed,  nuget.org will simply overwrite it, validation will be re-ran on this snupkg, and a success response (HTTP-201) is returned. 

- A special case is if server validation is currently executing on this snupkg (as it does immediately after a push), another push of the snupkg causes the server to return this duplicate error:

`Response status code does not indicate success: 409 (It looks like there is another copy of this symbols package pending validation(s). Please wait for the validation(s) to finish before trying to replace the symbols package.).`

### Describe the solution you'd like
It should be discussed whether nuget.org should continue overwriting snupkgs when they are pushed. At a minimum, the existing experience is inconsistent with nupkgs.

Some initial thoughts and discussion points:
**Minimal use-case:** The (only?) scenario where updating ("patching") an existing snupkg is if you didn't include all the PDBs in the original snupkg, and subsequently added them. Is this scenario common? Should we require them to Delete their symbols through "Delete Symbols" button on nuget.org before they can then push the snupkg again without a 409 Conflict?

**Version guidance:** Assumption here is that we prefer to not require a new package version when adding additional symbols to a snupkg. Thus, a user can incrementally fill a snupkg with PDBs as long as they don't modify the DLL.

**Server workload concern:**  pushing N nupkgs (say N=100) will involuntarily update <=100 snupkgs and trigger <=100 validations of symbols that have already been through validation (assuming this trigger happens even if there are no changes to the snupkg). 

### Additional context
NuGet Client Issue where this discussion came up: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8148
Discussion that lead to this issue by: @cristinamanum, @karann-msft, @rrelyea, @donnie-msft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Lightning does not treat package IDs as case insensitive" (#7680) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This in rare cases could lead to concurrency issues when two workers are updating the same hive at the same time.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/blob/e921a7eef360ee6bcc11b7ca9f94d96e93193a1c/src/Ng/Jobs/LightningJob.cs#L262

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The Visual Studio NuGet packages (RestoreManagerPackage and NuGetPackage packages) needs to auto load on solution build events" (#8796) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
See https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/792876. 


From a thread: 

We had a discussion on this and decided the proper way to do this is to whitelist the SolutionBuilding UI context for sync autoload. 

After the UI context is whitelisted, nuget will have to add the following into the package definition:
[ProvideAutoLoad(VSConstants.UICONTEXT.SolutionBuilding_string)]

Note that there should be no PackageAutoLoadFlags.BackgroundLoad flag in this registration. Otherwise your package will be async autoloaded, causing the same issue. Note that you may also want to keep the existing autoload on solution exists, as that’s async autoload and helps the Build performance sometimes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "In deprecation UI, alternate package with "*" range shows >= 0.0.0" (#8795) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

**NuGet product used:** Package Manager Console
**NuGet version:** 5.5.0.6293
**VS version:** 16.5.0 Preview 1.0 [29430.205.master]
**OS version:** Windows 10 Version 1909
**Worked before?** Yes with 5.4.0.6271

Likely changed behavior with https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3079.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open PM UI
1. Go to Browse tab
1. Make sure only nuget.org is the selected source
1. Search for Test4Nuggets
1. Select that package and look at the right side pane where it has deprecation information

It shows `>= 0.0.0`. I think this is confusing because 0.0.0 is not a real version on most packages and is kind of a side-effect of `*` having a minimum version of 0.0.0 in memory.

## Other suggested things

### Screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/68340443-55584300-009b-11ea-9de7-ad739edb3a3c.png)

Compare to nuget.org:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/68340800-f646fe00-009b-11ea-8eeb-9d1be82631a9.png)


/cc @xavierdecoster @nkolev92 @scottbommarito @anangaur   @xavierdecoster

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""version" environment variable improperly used" (#8794) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem If one sets the "version" environment variable prior to running `nuget restore` than the restore will fail if the value isn't something like 1.2.3 NuGet product used: NuGet.exe | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe NuGet version: 4.8.1.5435 dotnet.exe --version: 3.0.1 VS version: 16.3.7 OS version: Win10 v1809 (17763.805) Worked before? Unknown ## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem 1. `C:\> set version=foobar` 2. `C:\Users\me\source\repos\my-project> nuget.exe restore`
or 2. `C:\Users\me\source\repos\my-project> dotnet restore`
or 2. `C:\> devenv.exe` Then, from package manager console: 3. `PM> Update-Package -Reinstall` ## Other suggested things Documentation page https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-environment-variables doesn't reflect usage of the "version" environment variable. ### Verbose Logs [foobarlog.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3814825/foobarlog.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ErrorUnsafePackageEntry error message is not pointing to source of problem" (#7505) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet.exe

NuGet version (5.8.1.xxx):

1. create a package with a file with ~ at the end of extension 

2. create packages.config with above package record

3. use nuget restore in packages.config location

*. there is a chance that the file will not be validated and package will be extracted but usually it fails:

        C:\Jenkins\Workspace\SolutionName>nuget.exe restore 
        MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '15.8.169.51996' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\BuildTools\MSBuild\15.0\bin'.
        Restoring NuGet package PackageName.5.6.6.

        Adding package 'PackageName.5.6.6' to folder 'C:\Jenkins\Workspace\SolutionName\packages'
        WARNING: The package 'PackageName.5.6.6' contains an entry which is unsafe for extraction.
        Committing restore...

        Assets file has not changed. Skipping assets file writing. Path: C:\Jenkins\Workspace\SolutionName\ProjectName\obj\project.assets.json
        Restore completed in 92.29 ms for C:\Jenkins\Workspace\SolutionName\ProjectName\ProjectName.csproj.
        Errors in packages.config projects
            The package 'PackageName.5.6.6' contains an entry which is unsafe for extraction.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DG Spec for unloaded project scenarios should not be written in preview restores" (#8793) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Migrate .nuget\packages.config file in NuGet.Client to PackageDownload" (#8630) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

- NuGet product used: NuGet.exe 
- NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.1.*
- `dotnet.exe --version`: 2.1.70*, 2.2.30*

Worked before? No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Build NuGet.Client from this [git ref](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/dc72141d53cdec46b13c5a4a08ffdd5cefe7a3a1)

## Other suggested things

Currently, NuGet.Client project uses a packages.config file to download some initial packages needed by other build steps.

### Problems

- Only works with `nuget.exe`
- It becomes more difficult to specify conditional NuGet sources without using out-of-the-box tooling.

By migrating to `PackageDownload` we can get some benefits such as:

- Removing any dependency on nuget.exe in the local build
- Conditional project sources via `RestoreAdditionalProjectSources`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Using OData to query NuGet.org repository is being deprecated" (#37) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We introduced `V3 APIs` in early 2016. We have made continuous investments to make it more reliable, performant and secure. Going forward, we plan to bring all new features and improvements only to the newer `V3 APIs`. As part of this strategy, we are deprecating the usage of `OData` queries. Subsequently, we plan to **disable the `OData` queries starting Feb 5th, 2020**.

**Call to Action: Transition to V3 APIs**

Here are some resources to help you with the migration:
* [NuGet Server `V3 APIs` reference](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/switching-from-wcf-odata-to-web-api/)
* [Guide to transition from NuGet `V2 API` to `V3 API`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/guides/api/query-for-all-published-packages). 
* [Blog post: Switching from WCF OData to Web API](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/switching-from-wcf-odata-to-web-api/)

If you need further help in moving your use case to `V3 APIs`, do reach out to us at [support@nuget.org](mailto:support@nuget.org).
